Description: Wheel-made pottery oil-lamp with incurved sides and a short substantial nozzle, supported on a long stem of a columnar stand. Brown Nile silt fabric. Original base lost and replaced by a modern one.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Nottingham Castle Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See NA735 from Naukratis, otherwise see small lamps with stands have been found in Sicily (Bailey 1975, Q671 and Q672) and Rhodes (Ibid. Q379), dated 4th to early 3rd century BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.30) (Phase 3)
